member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormat
member.summary: Describes the kind of data to be formatted.
member.remarks: Values corresponding to letters may also be used as format specifiers when using a instance as the format provider. Other flags are only for use with when applied to properties.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormat.Default
member.summary: Data is formatted (with no privacy) using the type's standard or overridden `ToString()` method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormat.Text
member.summary: Text is hashed when privacy is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormat.Path
member.summary: File name or file path is partially hashed when privacy is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormat.Email
member.summary: Email address is partially hashed when privacy is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormat.Uri
member.summary: URI is partially hashed when privacy is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormat.Token
member.summary: Tokens are never formatted, regardless of whether privacy is enabled. Instead they are replaced by a placeholder.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormat.Omit
member.summary: Indicates a property should always be omitted from a formatted object, regardless of whether privacy is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormat.OmitDefault
member.summary: Indicates a property should be omitted from a formatted object if the value is null or the default value for the type, rather than included as "Name=null". Can be combined with other format flags.
member.remarks: This may be inferred from [DataMember(EmitDefaultValue=false)].

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormat.Hide
member.summary: Indicates a property should be omitted from a formatted object when privacy is enabled. Can be combined with other format flags.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormat.SingleMember
member.summary: An object that normally has a single non-null member value is formatted in a more-compact form.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormatAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a class or property should be formatted in a specific way by a format provider instance.
member.remarks: Use when `DataContract` and `DataMember` attributes are not used or do not provide sufficient formatting hints.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormatAttribute.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the kind of data represented by the property, for purposes of data formatting and hashing.
member.remarks: Not valid for use on a class attribute.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormatter
member.summary: Supports formatting various fields for logging purposes, including optional hashing of potentially sensitive information to protect privacy.
member.remarks:
This class implements `IFormatProvider`, so an instance can be passed as the first parameter to `String.Format()`. For example this line: String.Format(new DataFormatter(), "{0:P}", filePath); will use the `DataFormatter` to hash the file path when formatting it.
Use an instance of this class as the format provider for a class that extends `TraceListenerBase` to enable smart formatting of traced data objects.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormatter.Debug
member.summary: Format string suitable for use with DebuggerDisplayAttribute, for example: [DebuggerDisplay(DataFormatter.Debug)]

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.DataFormatter.Format(System.Object)
member.summary: Formats an object using the object's default format.
member.remarks: This static method does NOT use hashing, regardless of any instance setting.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.Privacy
member.summary: Manages a key used to hash sensitive data to ensure privacy.
member.remarks: Once generated (or set by a client), the key is stored in .NET isolated storage, so that it remains consistent across sessions. The key does not need to be stored in a secure vault because it is only used as an HMAC key for hashing the current user's data for tracing and telemetry; the hashed data is then uploaded without the key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.Privacy.Key
member.summary: Gets the key, generating it if not found in storage, or sets the key and stores it for later use.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.Retry.DoAsync(System.Func{System.Int32,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{System.ValueTuple{System.Boolean,System.Exception}}})
member.summary: DoAsync executes the passed action until it returns true, indicating success, or false if all attempts fail. Optionally, it returns an exception instance if one was provided by the action. It retries the number of times indicated by , and has an exponential backoff strategy with a base delay indicated by .
member.param: Action to execute, it should indicate if it succeeded, and optionally provide an exception if it didn't
member.returns: True if action succeded, false otherwise. Optionally an exception instance if the action failed and provided an exception.

member.param: Limit of times after which retrying doesn't occcur
Action to execute, it should indicate if it succeeded, and optionally provide an exception if it didn't
member.returns: True if action succeded, false otherwise. Optionally an exception instance if the action failed and provided an exception.

Action to execute, it should indicate if it succeeded, and optionally provide an exception if it didn't
member.returns: True if action succeded, false otherwise. Optionally an exception instance if the action failed and provided an exception.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.PathHelper
member.summary: A collection of file system path analysis and manipulation functions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.PathHelper.MakeRooted(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Generates an absolute path from a base path and another path.
member.param: An absolute path to use as the root if is relative. IMPORTANT: if basePath is a directory, it must end with a directory separator character or else it will be treated like a filename and discarded.
A relative or absolute path, that needs to be absolute.
member.exception: Thrown when the argument is not an absolute path.
member.returns: A normalized, absolute path. A path with relative parents (i.e. c:\temp\tmp\..\a.txt) will never be returned. Not necessarily canonical, in that the file casing of the path is not guaranteed to be consistent.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Common.PathHelper.MakeRelative(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: given the absolute location of a file, and a disc location, returns relative file path to that disk location.
member.param: The base path we want to relativize to. Must be absolute. Should not include a filename as the last segment will be interpreted as a directory.
The path we need to make relative to basePath. The path can be either absolute path or a relative path in which case it is relative to the base path
member.returns: The relative path (can be the full path when no relationship exists). If and are equivalent, the empty string is returned.

member.summary: Make sure there is no [unnecessary] trailing directory separator.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.IFileService
member.summary: Provides remote access to the file system of the current workspace.
member.remarks:
All paths are relative to one or more workspace root directories. If the workspace has multiple roots, the root name comes before the first slash in the path. (The root name is NOT prefixed with a slash.) / Unnamed (single) root directory /file.txt File in the unnamed root directory /dir/file.txt File in a subdirectory under the unnamed root root2 Named root directory root2/file.txt File in a named root directory
Most APIs have optional options. When an options argument is unspecified/null, it is equivalent to options with all default values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.FileListOptions.EnableMultipleRoots
member.summary: If true, multi-root style (indexed) paths are returned when listing roots. If false/unspecified, single-root style paths are returned when listing roots.

member.summary: If true, last-modified times and file sizes are included in results.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.FileListOptions.IncludeHidden
member.summary: If true, include hidden files in the listing.

member.summary: Specifies how descendants of listed items should be included in the results.

member.summary: List of (.gitignore style) patterns to exclude from results.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.FileListOptions.IncludePatterns
member.summary: List of (.gitignore style) patterns to include in results.

member.summary: Specifies what descendents should be included when listing or watching a path.

member.summary: Do not recurse; just return info about the requested items.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.FileRecurseMode.Children
member.summary: Return info about the requsted items and their immediate children.

member.summary: Return info about the requested items and their immediate children, but if a requested item has only one child then include info about the only child's children as well. (This optimization is used by VS Code.)

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.FileRecurseMode.AllDescendants

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.IWorkspaceService.RegisterServicesAsync(System.String[],Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.WorkspaceServicesChangeType,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Registers or unregisters service proxies that enable the client to provide RPC services to other clients in the workspace.
member.remarks:
Other clients can make RPC requests to the registered services by name without knowing details about exactly who is providing each service. (Services can still be provided by the agent also.) Services registered by clients can also raise events, which then get broadcast as RPC notification messages to any other clients that are listening for events from the service. (Where broadcast functionality is not needed, consider using a request instead of events; requests and responses are never broadcast.)
If there are multiple instances of the same service, RPC requests to that service may result in an error when a single service provider cannot be identified. (But when are 2 providers of a service and the caller is one of them, then the request is delivered to the non-caller provider, because there are no loopback requests so there is no ambiguity.) However, multiple instances of a service may all broadcast notifications without limitations.
The client must separately register the service implementation(s) on its RPC session. Also before invoking this method, a current workspace must have been already set via a share or join request. The registrations only last as long as the current workspace sesssion.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.WorkspaceSessionInfo.SessionNumber
member.summary: Integer that identifies the session with the workspace, guaranteed to be unique across all other sessions connected to the same workspace at the same time.
member.remarks: Session numbers are assigned by the workspace hosting agent. They are valid for the duration of a collaboration session, not for the extended lifetime a workspace. That means if a workspace owner stops sharing and then later re-shares the same workspace, the session numbers may be different (and numbers may be re-used from past sharing sessions).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cascade.Contracts.WorkspaceSessionInfo.ConversationId
member.summary: String that identifies the collective shared workspace conversation that's happening across all participants.
member.remarks: Conversation ID is set by the cloud services whenever the owner shares a workspace or re-joins a workspace that they previously shared. The conversation ID is then shared across all parties that connect to the workspace (both owner and participants) in order to correlate the telemetry events emitted.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cascade.Tracing.TraceSourceExtensions.NonFormattableString
member.summary: Work around an overload resolution problem with `FormattableString`, enabling interpolated string to be used with tracing efficiently while also supporting plain strings.
member.remarks:
See Overloaded string methods with string interpolation.
An extra implicit conversion causes the compiler to prefer the overloads that take `FormattableString` when interpolated strings are used with the tracing methods. While plain `string` parameters get converted to/from this struct, the conversions should basically evaporate in inlining.
